get.description:
List of Interface Profile configuration. Interface Profile is bundle of interface configuration
for devices with specific sku/model. Defined for set of uplink/downlink ports for given models.
Interface Profile can be defined for stacks/chassis for fixed/automatic set of members/LineCards.
Interface Profile can be defined for custom stack/chassis size.
One Interface Profile can have port-profile config for uplink + downlink + custom ports for given
model/device type. In case of stacks, Interface Profile will not be applied VSF link ports, if they
are part of automatic/custom Interface Profile model+ports.

post.summary: Configure Interface Profile by unique name.
post.description:
Interface Profile configuration. It is a bundle of interface configuration
for devices with specific sku/model. Defined for set of uplink/downlink ports, or can
be for custom set of ports for given models. Interface Profile can be defined for stacks/chassis for
fixed/automatic set of members/LineCards. Interface Profile can be defined for custom stack/chassis size.
One Interface Profile can have port-profile config for uplink + downlink + custom ports for given
model/device type. In case of stacks, Interface Profile will not be applied VSF link ports, if they
are part of automatic/custom Interface Profile model+ports.

get.summary: Read existing Interface Profile Configuration for given name.
get.description:
Interface Profile configuration. It is a bundle of interface configuration
for devices with specific sku/model. Defined for set of uplink/downlink ports, or can
be for custom set of ports for given models. Interface Profile can be defined for stacks/chassis for
fixed/automatic set of members/LineCards. Interface Profile can be defined for custom stack/chassis size.
One Interface Profile can have port-profile config for uplink + downlink + custom ports for given
model/device type. In case of stacks, Interface Profile will not be applied VSF link ports, if they
are part of automatic/custom Interface Profile model+ports.

patch.summary: Update existing Interface Profile configurations for given name.
patch.description:
Interface Profile configuration. It is a bundle of interface configuration
for devices with specific sku/model. Defined for set of uplink/downlink ports, or can
be for custom set of ports for given models. Interface Profile can be defined for stacks/chassis for
fixed/automatic set of members/LineCards. Interface Profile can be defined for custom stack/chassis size.
One Interface Profile can have port-profile config for uplink + downlink + custom ports for given
model/device type. In case of stacks, Interface Profile will not be applied VSF link ports, if they
are part of automatic/custom Interface Profile model+ports.

delete.summary: Delete Interface Profile configurations for given name.
delete.description:
Interface Profile configuration. It is a bundle of interface configuration
for devices with specific sku/model. Defined for set of uplink/downlink ports, or can
be for custom set of ports for given models. Interface Profile can be defined for stacks/chassis for
fixed/automatic set of members/LineCards. Interface Profile can be defined for custom stack/chassis size.
One Interface Profile can have port-profile config for uplink + downlink + custom ports for given
model/device type. In case of stacks, Interface Profile will not be applied VSF link ports, if they
are part of automatic/custom Interface Profile model+ports.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaInterfaceProfile_InterfaceProfilesS.description:
List of Interface Profile configuration. Interface Profile is bundle of interface configuration
for devices with specific sku/model. Defined for set of uplink/downlink ports for given models.
Interface Profile can be defined for stacks/chassis for fixed/automatic set of members/LineCards.
Interface Profile can be defined for custom stack/chassis size.
One Interface Profile can have port-profile config for uplink + downlink + custom ports for given
model/device type. In case of stacks, Interface Profile will not be applied VSF link ports, if they
are part of automatic/custom Interface Profile model+ports.

interface-profile.description:
Interface Profile configuration. It is a bundle of interface configuration
for devices with specific sku/model. Defined for set of uplink/downlink ports, or can
be for custom set of ports for given models. Interface Profile can be defined for stacks/chassis for
fixed/automatic set of members/LineCards. Interface Profile can be defined for custom stack/chassis size.
One Interface Profile can have port-profile config for uplink + downlink + custom ports for given
model/device type. In case of stacks, Interface Profile will not be applied VSF link ports, if they
are part of automatic/custom Interface Profile model+ports.

description.description: Description for the Interface Profile config.

x-enumDescriptions.SWITCH_STACK_AUTOMATIC: Includes stack profiles applied for all members
x-enumDescriptions.SWITCH_STACK_CUSTOM: Includes custom profiles applied to each stack member
x-enumDescriptions.SWITCH_MODULAR_AUTOMATIC: Includes profiles added to line-card module supported switches
x-enumDescriptions.SWITCH_MODULAR_CUSTOM: Includes custom interface profiles added to line-card module supported switches
x-enumDescriptions.SWITCH_LINECARD: Line card interface profile used for Modular custom/automatic

device-type.x-typeDescription: Interface Profile applied to device types.
device-type.description:
Interface Profile device type. Device type can be for STANDALONE, STACK, MODULAR. With custom/automatic
specifications. This field cannot be edited once created.

switch-standalone.description:
Switch port grouping. This container defines standalone switch configurations,
including model specification, port types, and interface mappings for both uplink
and downlink ports. It provides a comprehensive framework for applying consistent
port settings across standalone switch deployments with specific hardware models.

switch-linecard.description:
Switch port grouping. This container defines linecard switch configurations,
including model specification, port types, and interface mappings for both uplink
and downlink ports. It provides a comprehensive framework for applying consistent
port settings across standalone switch deployments with specific hardware models.

switch-stack-automatic.description:
Switch stack automatic port grouping. This container enables uniform Interface Profile configuration
across all members in a switch stack with identical hardware. It simplifies management
by allowing administrators to define a single configuration that is automatically
applied to all stack members, ensuring consistent behavior across the stack.

switch-stack-custom.description:
Switch stack custom port grouping. This container supports heterogeneous stack
configurations by allowing different Interface Profiles for each member in the stack.
It provides granular control over interface settings for each stack member,
accommodating different hardware models or functional roles within the stack.

switch-modular-automatic.description:
Automatic Interface Profile configuration for switches with modules. This container provides a
simplified configuration approach for modular switches, applying consistent Interface Profile
settings across all installed line cards. It is ideal for homogeneous modular
deployments where all modules serve similar functions in the network.

switch-modular-custom.description:
Custom Interface Profile configuration for switches with modules. This container enables
precise control over interface settings for each line card in a modular switch.
It supports advanced network designs where different modules may require specialized
configurations based on their position, connectivity, or functional role.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

description.description: Description for the Interface Profile config.

x-enumDescriptions.SWITCH_STACK_AUTOMATIC: Includes stack profiles applied for all members
x-enumDescriptions.SWITCH_STACK_CUSTOM: Includes custom profiles applied to each stack member
x-enumDescriptions.SWITCH_MODULAR_AUTOMATIC: Includes profiles added to line-card module supported switches
x-enumDescriptions.SWITCH_MODULAR_CUSTOM: Includes custom interface profiles added to line-card module supported switches
x-enumDescriptions.SWITCH_LINECARD: Line card interface profile used for Modular custom/automatic

ArubaInterfaceProfile_SwitchStackBaseMod.description:
A grouping for switch model. This grouping defines the hardware model identifier
used for associating specific Interface Profile configurations with compatible hardware platforms.
It enables targeting of configuration sets to switches with the same model type,
ensuring consistent interface settings across identical hardware.

x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_6200: SW_CX 6200 is base model for both 6200M and 6200F member platforms
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_6300: SW_CX 6300 is base model for both 6300M and 6300F member platforms
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_6300L: SW_CX 6300L is base model for 6300L member platforms

switch-series.x-typeDescription:
Base model types for switch stacks. These models represent the core
switch platforms that support stack configurations with consistent
hardware capabilities across stack members.
switch-series.description:
The model type of the switch. This specifies the physical model identifier
for switches across different form factors and capabilities. Each model
type corresponds to a specific hardware platform with predetermined port
counts, uplink configurations, and features like PoE support. This leaf
is used to target Interface Profile configurations to specific hardware models.
This field cannot be edited once created. Allowed series 6300, 6200, 6300L

ArubaInterfaceProfile_SwitchChassisModel.description:
A grouping for switch model. This grouping defines the hardware model identifier
used for associating specific Interface Profile configurations with compatible hardware platforms.
It enables targeting of configuration sets to switches with the same model type,
ensuring consistent interface settings across identical hardware.

switch-model.x-typeDescription:
Chassis model types for modular switches. These models represent
chassis-based switch platforms that support line cards and modular
configurations with scalable port densities and advanced features.
switch-model.description:
The model type of the switch. This specifies the physical model identifier
for switches across different form factors and capabilities. Each model
type corresponds to a specific hardware platform with predetermined port
counts, uplink configurations, and features like PoE support. This leaf
is used to target Interface Profile configurations to specific hardware models.
This field cannot be edited once created. Allowed model 6405, 6410, 8400, 8400X, 5420.

ArubaInterfaceProfile_SwitchModelGroupin.description:
A grouping for switch model. This grouping defines the hardware model identifier
used for associating specific Interface Profile configurations with compatible hardware platforms.
It enables targeting of configuration sets to switches with the same model type,
ensuring consistent interface settings across identical hardware.

switch-model.description:
The model type of the switch. This specifies the physical model identifier
for switches across different form factors and capabilities. Each model
type corresponds to a specific hardware platform with predetermined port
counts, uplink configurations, and features like PoE support. This leaf
is used to target Interface Profile configurations to specific hardware models.
This field cannot be edited once created.

ArubaInterfaceProfile_SwitchPortTypeGrou.description:
A grouping for port-type. This grouping encapsulates the physical characteristics
and capabilities of switch ports, allowing Interface Profile configurations to target specific
port types based on their media, speed, and functional capabilities. It enables
precise control over port configurations across different hardware platforms.

x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_12G_2SFP: CX Switch with 12 copper ports and 2 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_12G_PoE_2SFP: CX Switch with 12 copper ports and 2 uplink ports, poe supported
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_16SFP_2SFP: CX Switch with 16 fiber ports and 2 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_22G_PoE: CX Switch with 22 copper, poe supported
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_24SFP_2SFP: CX Switch with 24 fiber ports and 2 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_24SFP_4SFP: CX Switch with 24 fiber ports and 4 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_24G_4SFP: CX Switch with 24 copper ports and 4 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_24G_8SFP: CX Switch with 24 copper ports and 8 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_24G_PoE: CX Switch with 24 copper, poe supported
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_24G_PoE_4SFP: CX Switch with 24 copper and 4 uplink fiber ports, poe supported
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_32SFP_2SFP: CX Switch with 32 fiber ports and 2 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_32SFP_4SFP: CX Switch with 32 fiber ports and 4 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_32SFP_8SFP: CX Switch with 32 fiber ports and 8 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_32G_12SFP: CX Switch with 32 copper ports and 12 uplink ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_40SFP_12SFP: CX Switch with 40 fiber ports and 12 copper ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_48SFP_4SFP: CX Switch with 48 fiber ports and 4 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_48SFP_6SFP: CX Switch with 48 fiber ports and 6 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_48SFP_6SFP_ALT: CX Switch with 48 fiber ports and 6 copper ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_48SFP_8SFP: CX Switch with 48 fiber ports and 8 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_48G_12SFP: CX Switch with 48 copper ports and 12 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_48G_4SFP: CX Switch with 48 copper ports and 4 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_48G_6SFP: CX Switch with 48 copper ports and 6 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_48G_PoE: CX Switch with 48 copper, poe supported
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_48G_PoE_4SFP: CX Switch with 48 copper and 4 uplink fiber ports, poe supported
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_64SFP_2SFP: CX Switch with 64 fiber ports and 2 uplink fiber ports
x-enumDescriptions.SW_CX_8G_2SFP: CX Switch with 8 copper ports and 2 uplink fiber ports

port-type.description:
Port type specification including PoE capability, copper/fiber media type,
total port count, and other port-specific features for the switch model.
This defines which ports on the device will be included in the Interface Profile configuration,
such as all ports, only copper ports, only fiber ports, or specific subsets
of ports based on their capabilities and intended usage.
This field cannot be edited once created.

ArubaInterfaceProfile_SwitchProfileGroup.description:
Switch profile grouping. This grouping associates port profiles with interfaces,
providing a mechanism to apply predefined configuration templates to switch ports.
These profiles contain standardized settings for security, QoS, VLANs, and other
interface parameters that can be consistently applied across multiple devices.

sw-port-profile.description: Switch Port Profile (if any) associated with the interface.

ArubaInterfaceProfile_SwitchLinkGrouping.description:
Switch models and port-profile. This grouping establishes the relationship between
switch hardware models and their port configurations, allowing for differentiated
treatment of uplink and downlink ports. It enables the application of specific profiles
to different port types based on their role in the network topology.

uplink-port-map.description:
List of all the uplink ports and associated port-profiles references.
User's discretion is opted to fill the uplink port range. No validation
is performed to verify whether given port range is uplink ports

uplink-port.x-typeDescription:
Comma separated list of PORT IDs and ranges.
PortID or only single-tagged PortIDs or both. A range is
specified as x-y where x and y are valid Port IDs
(1 <= port-id <= 64). The range is assumed to be inclusive,
such that any Port-ID matching x <= Port-ID <= y falls within
the range. Example 1,2-3,4
uplink-port.description: Comma separated Uplink Ports/range in format 1,2-4.

downlink-port-map.description:
List of all the downlink ports and associated port-profiles references.
User's discretion is required to fill the downlink port range.
No validation is performed to verify whether given port range is uplink/downlink ports

downlink-port.x-typeDescription:
Comma separated list of PORT IDs and ranges.
PortID or only single-tagged PortIDs or both. A range is
specified as x-y where x and y are valid Port IDs
(1 <= port-id <= 64). The range is assumed to be inclusive,
such that any Port-ID matching x <= Port-ID <= y falls within
the range. Example 1,2-3,4
downlink-port.description: Comma separated downlink Ports/range in format 1,2-4.

ArubaInterfaceProfile_ModularAutomaticGr.description:
Modular automatic container with line-card info. This grouping provides
a framework for automatically applying consistent Interface Profile configurations across all
linecard in a modular chassis. It simplifies administration by treating
multiple physical components as a single logical entity with uniform configuration.

items.description:
List of Linecard Interface Profile references. Only LINECARD type interface-profile can
be present in the list. The model-type of the Stack/Modular should match with
linecard Interface Profile.

ArubaInterfaceProfile_StackAutomaticGrou.description:
Stack/Modular automatic container with member/line-card info. This grouping provides
a framework for automatically applying consistent Interface Profile configurations across all members
of a stack or modules in a modular chassis. It simplifies administration by treating
multiple physical components as a single logical entity with uniform configuration.

items.description:
List of Standalone Interface Profile references. Only standalone interface-profile can
be present in the list. The model-type of the Stack/Modular should match with
standalone Interface Profile.

ArubaInterfaceProfile_StackCustomGroupin.description:
A grouping for defining custom stack configurations with detailed member information.
This grouping enables the creation of heterogeneous switch stacks with specific member counts,
varying port types, and individual Interface Profiles for each member. Unlike automatic stack
configurations that apply a uniform configuration across identical stack members, this
custom grouping allows for precise control over each stack member's configuration, supporting
deployments with mixed switch models or varying port requirements across the stack.

member-count.description:
The total number of switch members in the custom stack configuration. This value
determines how many switches will be managed as a single logical entity in the stack.
The range is limited to 0-10 members, where 0 indicates an empty stack definition
that can be populated later, and values 1-10 represent the actual number of physical
switches in the stack.

members.description:
A list containing configuration details for individual switch members in the stack.
Each entry represents a single physical switch with its own member ID, port configuration,
and Interface Profile references. This allows for heterogeneous stack configurations where
different switch models can be combined into a single managed stack. The list is limited
to a maximum of 10 elements, matching the maximum supported stack size.

member-id.description:
The unique identifier for a member switch within the stack. This ID serves as
the primary key for identifying individual switches in the stack configuration.
Valid values range from 0 to 10, corresponding to the physical position or
assigned ID of each switch in the stack topology.

ArubaInterfaceProfile_ModularCustomGroup.description:
Modular custom grouping. This grouping enables detailed configuration of modular switches
with line cards.

line-cards.description:
Detailed configuration of modular switches with line cards, allowing administrators to
specify different Interface Profiles for each module based on its port type. It supports heterogeneous chassis
deployments where line cards may have different port densities.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
